title: BBC Local Live: Northamptonshire for Tuesday 25 August 2015 - BBC News
summary: reports of a gunman at northampton station turned out to be youngsters with an air gun .
northampton town prepare to face newcastle in the capital one cup tonight .
news , sport , travel and weather updates resume at 08:00 on wednesday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for northamptonshire have finished for the day , but we 'll be back from 08:00 tomorrow with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .

documents.title: police officer 'beating video ' probed
text: an investigation has been launched after phone footage appeared on social media apparently showing northamptonshire police officers assaulting a man with autism .
the victim 's family says they are consulting legal action .
in a statement , northamptonshire police say they are taking the allegations extremely seriously and have referred the matter to the professional standards department .
you can find out more on bbc look east on bbc one at 18:30 .
author: David Keller
BBC News

documents.title: buckingham advertiser : town centre plans unveiled
text: a planning document looking at potential development sites in towcester town centre is out for public consultation .

documents.title: train disruption following 'gunman ' fears
text: london midland trains has tweeted that because of the gunman fears at northampton station earlier , trains are being delayed into the early evening .
london midland
londonmidland
# northampton update 4 : trains are now on the move to/from # euston .
however we do expect disruption until at least 19:00 .
no need to panic - eyewitness reports of a gunman actually ended up being children shooting tin cans with an airgun close to the railway line .
but if you 're coming back from london shortly , you may need to allow extra time for your journey .
# northampton update 4 : trains are now on the move to/from # euston .
however we do expect disruption until at least 19:00 .
@ twitterid all i can say is that it was a police operation alan , thankfully they conducted their enquiries quickly .
@ twitterid @ twitterid was it british transport police or northamptonshire police , out of interest ?
@ twitterid @ twitterid i believe both were involved jack .
author: David Keller
BBC News

documents.title: train driver made gunman call
text: we 've just been told the original call to police about a gunman at northampton railway station was actually from a train driver .
they reported seeing someone with a gun near the railway line , leading to armed police swooping on the area and the station being briefly shut .
as it transpired , it was actually children playing with an air gun .
they were subsequently given a telling off by police .
author: David Keller
BBC News

documents.title: decision on 208,000 panel solar farm due
text: i 've been hearing from a range of voices opposed to a plan to create a 208,000 panel solar farm at the former raf desborough site .

wilbarston parish council is concerned about unofficial footpaths across the site which have been used for decades , while desborough town council objects to the development because of issues with rights of way across the land .
kettering borough 's planning committee is being recommended to approve the farm - decision time is 19:00 .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: gunman fears were children shooting tin cans
text: northamptonshire police had calls from the world 's media '' this afternoon after rumours circulated on social media that a gunman was on the rampage at northampton railway station .
there had been reports to police that someone near the railway line had been seen with a gun .
in truth , some young people in a nearby park were taking shots at tin cans with an air rifle .
officers searched the area and no arrests were made , but they advised the young people not to use an airgun in a public place .
author: Laura Devlin
BBC News

documents.title: northamptonshire investors should spread risk
text: today on bbc radio northampton i heard how the stock market problems in recent days , especially in china , could affect you - and how you can protect yourself if you 're an investor .
china 's main stock exchange fell by a further 7.6 % overnight , but european markets rallied this morning .
jason mcconkey is an independent financial advisor at barry johnson financial services in blisworth .
he told me most people 's pension funds and isas are invested in a mixture of shares , property and cash products .
author: Helen Blaby
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: horse rider taken to hospital
text: a horse rider has been taken to hospital after being rescued from a ditch on the northants-cambridgeshire border .
northamptonshire fire and rescue service said the female rider was found hurt with her horse in a field near keyston , just outside raunds , at about 13:40 .
she was taken to hospital with pelvic and possible back injuries .
the horse was not hurt .
incident 13:39 horse and rider rescued from ditch by fire crews - # keyston
author: David Keller
BBC News

documents.title: northampton chronicle & echo : council looks to evict travellers
text: travellers who set up an illegal camp on land at a former middle school in northampton are to be evicted .
author: Northampton Chronicle & Echo

documents.title: relive the league cup memories : liverpool v northampton town
text: it 's nearly five years since northampton town beat liverpool on penalties at anfield in the third round of the league cup .
can they repeat the incredible scenes of that night ?
all the in the video are the copyright of getty images .
author: BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: good afternoon : northamptonshire news this afternoon
text: hello all .
i 'll be taking over this afternoon bringing you the latest news , sport , weather and travel for northamptonshire .
please get in touch with your stories or comments until 18:00 via email , facebook or twitter .
author: David Keller
BBC News

documents.title: police appeal over town centre serious assault
text: northamptonshire police wants your help with identifying a man it 's believed took part in a serious assault on a man in northampton town centre in the early hours of monday morning .
the victim was attacked on gold street near the junction with college street at 03:00 .
two men were arrested at the scene , a third escaped .
he 's described as a black or asian man in his late-teens to early twenties and was wearing dark-blue jeans , a dark-coloured long-sleeved top and black trainers .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northamptonshire headlines : stock market investors urged to be cautious solar farm decision due
text: here are our top stories this afternoon in northamptonshire :
author: BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: can cobblers repeat famous cup success ?
text: supporters have left sixfields for the trip to newcastle , but can we have a repeat of this , at anfield , nearly five years ago ?
jenny parker , from sixfields travel club , says they 've got 250 people travelling with them .
a thousand cobblers fans will be in the stands for the capital one cup fixture .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: singing to fight against dementia
text: the alzheimers society says it 's looking to expand the number of 'singing for the brain ' groups it runs in northamptonshire .
the sessions allow people with dementia and their carers to get together once a week to socialise and sing classic songs .
there are currently four groups in the county , but the charity says it 's looking at the possibility of new groups in areas like wellingborough and brackley .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: decision time on solar farm plan for wwii airfield
text: plans to build a solar farm on land once occupied by raf desborough are due to be considered for planning permission tonight .
wellington bombers flew from the site during world war two , but soon it could have 208,000 solar panels producing around 50 megawatts of electricity each year .
people have called for footpaths used by ramblers and dog walkers to be protected .
kettering borough council 's planning committee meeting starts at 19:00 .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: east northamptonshire schools 'ready for new term '
text: the £ 22m switch from three to two-tier education for schools in east northamptonshire is well underway - and northamptonshire county council says schools will be ready for the new academic year .
the past 18 months have seen some bitter arguments between parents and the council , particularly at middle schools which have been closed , such as king john in thrapston .
the county council says children in thrapston , oundle , kings cliffe and surrounding villages have been doing less well than their peers and that the switch will improve performance .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: cobblers fans ready for the long trip north
text: radio northampton 's kris holland is joining northampton town fans in their coach convoy to newcastle for tonight 's capital one cup match .

documents.title: cobblers legend turned newcastle scout on tonight 's match
text: former northampton town player and manager graham carr is now chief scout at newcastle united .
i 've been speaking to him about tonight 's capital one cup match - and his memories of the last time the two sides met , in 1987 .
tonight 's capital one cup match could be a classic - and northampton fans will be desperate for a repeat of the barmy scenes at anfield in 2010 .
radio northampton will have full coverage from 19:00 tonight .
author: Stuart Linnell
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northamptonshire headlines : green light for 99p stores sale seven weeks to find a new care home
text: here are our latest top stories :
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: prescription drugs stolen
text: northamptonshire police is appealing for information after a blue ford focus was broken into in wellingborough and a number of venlalic prescription tablets stolen .
it happened in prior road in the town , overnight between thursday 20 august and friday , 21 august .
they are also advising anyone who finds the tablets not to take them but to drop them into the nearest police station or pharmacy .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: weather : brightness giving way to rain
text: it 'll become increasingly cloudy into the afternoon with outbreaks of light rain from mid-afternoon onwards .
maximum temperature : 17c ( 63f )
tonight : cloudy overnight with further outbreaks of mainly light rain , though some heavier outbreaks are likely in the early hours of wednesday .
minimum temperature : 14c ( 57f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: daventry express : daventry school shuts lower sixth form to year 12 students
text: daventry 's dslv school has closed the first year of its sixth form .
the school took the decision after just seven people applied to start year 12 ( lower sixth form ) at the school this september .
author: Daventry Express

documents.title: cobblers boss on newcastle united : 'it does n't get any bigger '
text: northampton town boss chris wilder says they are n't going to newcastle tonight to `` roll over and have our tummies tickled '' .
the cobblers have form in the league cup against premier league opposition ; their win against liverpool at anfield in 2010 has gone down in history .
there 'll be full commentary from newcastle tonight from 19:00 on bbc radio northampton .
author: Stuart Linnell
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: motorsport reacts to death of justin wilson
text: teams from across the world of motorsport have been reacting after british indycar and former formula 1 driver justin wilson died in the usa from head injuries sustained in a race on sunday .

documents.title: northampton-based 99p stores ' sale could be given green light
text: poundland 's £ 55m bid for northampton-based 99p stores has been given a provisional green light .
the competition and markets authority has decided the sale wo n't leave shoppers worse off , in terms of price or choice of products .
99p stores is based at swan valley , next to junction 15a of the m1 .
it has 251 stores across the uk and serves two million customers a week .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northants herald & post : the homing pigeon that just wo n't go home
text: a northampton family fear they are stuck with a racing pigeon who has decided to make their living room its new home .
author: Northants Herald & Post

documents.title: seven weeks to find a new care home in northamptonshire
text: families of people with physical and mental disabilities in our county have been telling me how hard it is to find a new care home for their loved ones .
the greenfields unit at the pathfields lodge care home , near irchester , cares for people with complex needs .
its owners insist the closure is temporary , but 11 of the 19 people who live there have to find somewhere new to live - and have only seven weeks to do it .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: closure means 'there 's nothing out there ' for dementia sufferers
text: the mother of a 38-year-old woman with a rare hereditary form of dementia says there 's nowhere else for her daughter to go , after the operators of her current care home announced it 'll close in seven weeks time .
rita from rushden , whose identity we are protecting , lost her husband to the disease .
her daughter then developed it in her early thirties .
she says there 's no-where else that caters for people who have dementia at such a young age .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: the sun : football star 's shot breaks his girlfriend 's wrist
text: an exeter player broke his girlfriend 's wrist with a blistering shot he blasted over the bar , while warming up for his side 's game against northampton town .
author: The Sun

documents.title: cobblers going for cup glory against newcastle
text: nearly five years after northampton town knocked liverpool out of the league cup , the current batch of players will be hoping for a repeat performance at newcastle tonight .
abdul osman struck the winning penalty in the pouring rain that night at anfield in the third round of what was then the carling cup .
tonight 's game against newcastle will be live on bbc radio northampton .
author: Stuart Linnell
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: british indycar driver dies after crash
text: the organisers of the indycar series have paid tribute to british driver justin wilson , who has died from head injuries he sustained in a race on sunday in pennsylvania , usa .
he was struck on the head by debris from an accident in front of him and never recovered .
wilson lived in northampton when he previously raced in formula 1 .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northamptonshire headlines seven weeks to find a new care home ten years of the university
text: here 're our top stories for this morning
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: weather : bright start , turning rainy
text: it 'll be a dry morning with some good sunny spells , but by the afternoon it 'll be becoming increasingly cloudy , with outbreaks of light rain from mid-afternoon onwards .
quite breezy at first , but winds becoming light by midday .
maximum temperature : 17c ( 63f ) .
you can see this morning 's forecast here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome to today 's northamptonshire live page
text: welcome to the live page for tuesday , 25 august .
we want to hear what you 're up to ; especially if you 're following the cobblers on the long drive to newcastle .
you can email me here , follow us on facebook and like us on twitter .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton
